data.title: Bruce Cabot
data.meta_description: Sold for $123 | Actor (1904–1972) best remembered as Fay Wray’s savior in 1933’s King Kong, Cabot was a drinking buddy of John Wayne’s
data.text:
Actor (1904–1972) best remembered as Fay Wray’s savior in 1933’s King Kong, Cabot was a drinking buddy of John Wayne’s and spent the latter part of his career working almost exclusively in the Duke’s starring vehicles. Vintage glossy 8 x 10 head-and-shoulders photo, signed and inscribed in-person in fountain pen “To Saul, Bruce Cabot.” Reverse of photo bears collector’s stamp date of March 4, 1939, the date the signature was acquired. In fine condition, with a couple trivial corner tip dings. Pre-certified PSA/DNA and RRAuction COA.

Auction Info

Auction Title: Hollywood

Dates: #371 - Ended May 19, 2011

This item is Pre-Certified by PSA/DNA

If you wish to have an opinion rendered by a different authenticator of your choosing, you must do so prior to your placing of any bid. RR Auction is not responsible for differing opinions submitted 30 days after the date of the sale.
